name: Vectorball
description:
This one on one future sport combines ideas from a number of real-world competitions, most notably the schoolgirl favourite Netball (I wonder why the ad blurb makes no mention of this?). The action is viewed isometrically, so moving the joystick up moves your droid north-east, down moves south-west, and so on.

The aim is to score more points than your opponent in each match, and be the first to win four matches (against either a human or computer opponent), before moving up to the next difficulty level. There is a goal in the middle at each end, and the ball can be advanced by shooting it (the length of a shot is affected by pushing the joystick up or down with fire pressed) as you can't run with the ball, or hold onto it for long. The main novel idea in the game is the shaping of the pitches, which are viewed in full 3D and have bumps and big divots all around.
alsoFor: Amiga, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, DOS | Combined View

shot.caption: This screen is displayed as the game loads
This screen follows the load screen. Text scrolls across the bottom with copyright information & developer credits. A key must be pressed in order to progress
The game' main menu. Pressing 1 or 2 cycles through the available controllers for each player. Help text scrolls across the bottom of the screen
Option 3 from the main menu allows the player(s) to choose which kind of game arena they want to play in. Again help text scrolls across the bottom of the screen
With the controllers and the game area both selected all that remains is to decide how long a match will last
The game now has to load the game ready for play. This also occurs after each match
The start of a game in 'The Hills'. Both players stand either side of a hill with the ball on top. The goals are at the top of the ramps at either side
Within seconds Player One scores, unfortunately this was the computer as I was struggling with the controls.
After a goal the play area is reset and the game progresses until the countdown reaches zero. The current score scrolls diagonally across the top edge of the play area
In the last minute of play the countdown timer is displayed against a red background.
At the end of the game the winner is displayed. The game does not show the full score, which in this case was 13-0, just who won
Then the current score of games won is displayed. After this the game re-displays the 'Please Wait' screen while it reloads the game and then the whole cycle repeats.
The start of a game on "The Ditches" play area. I had to go through a full reset & reload to play a game on another arena and this, of course, cleared the games won scores
This screen shot shows that when Player Two scores a goal its displayed in a different colour. It also shows that it's possible to score an own goal.
The start of a game in "Wave City"
The game always keeps the ball on-screen. This is a problem for an inexperienced player because they  don't know what direction their character is facing
This is the Megamix play area
The head of the player with possession of the ball always floats above the body, I guess that's because it's so excited
